alert.note: Alert for McCormick (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 10:52AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McDuffie, Columbia, Lincoln, west central Richmond and McCormick Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1050 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nancy Hart State Park to 6 miles north of Mitchell. Movement was east at 40 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Strom Thurmond Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grovetown, Evans, Thomson, McCormick, Harlem, Lincolnton, Appling, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Elijah Clark State Park, Riverwood, Mistletoe State Park, Wrightsboro, Hamilton Branch State Park, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Mccormick County Airport, Thomson-McDuffie County Airport, Lake Strom Thurmond, Bobby Brown State Park, Blythe, and Dearing. This includes Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 167 and 192. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
